title: My issue with placements (Don't worry not a 'I got placed lower' moan)
body:
I haven't even done my solo duo placements yet, so this isn't a bitch about being placed lower, you can relax now. :P

#A friend in need

Im more making this post because of my observations of a friend. 
The friend that got me into league, is and has always been, better than me at the game. 
My game sense isn't bad at all, its probably the thing i'm best at, and his is way better. His mechanics are good, he's an ADC main, he plays every ADC very well, and he picks his champions entirely based off allied and enemy team comps. Also, unlike me, he actually bothers to learn about the finer points of the game to try and get ahead.


He's been playing for around 7 years now, and just like every other season, he just got placed bronze 5.
 

#The students best the teacher

He taught me to play, Ive worked _(side note, NEVER 'placed in')_ my way up to silver every year for several years now, _(and I play shit-all ranked.)_
He taught another one of out friends to play a year or so ago, that friend got placed silver
He taught someone that I introduced into the game, and that friend got silver 2 in a placements once.
He finally convinced his girlfriend to start playing _**a**_ _**month ago**_, she just got placed silver. She only plays 3 champs...

But every season, no matter how many wins he gets in placements, bronze 5.
Just because the very first time he played ranked, when he was still new, he didn't do well in his placements. So every year afterwards, because you always get placed lower, he always gets slapped right back at the bottom. 

He has said many times to me that he doesn't mind being placed low, it just makes the climb more interesting and satisfying. 
But i've seen his games, and because he's always at the bottom, he gets matched with the most special souls... bless them.


#it shouldn't be: Improvement OR Ranked.

And seeming we play tons of normals together _(my normals games number way over 4000)_, we have much more accurate mmr in normals, which I think is gold level _(or at least I hope so, seeming there are golds in all our games all the time)_, and he goes from that level of play which challenges both of us, to having his support spend the whole fight walking back and forth deciding wether go in or run away, and failing to do either.

I've been in bronze 5 before, and I don't care what anyone says, that shit is wayyyy harder than anything i've seen in silver, or at gold level. 
It was hell of a lot of work, completely overshadowed by pure luck, that got me out of it. And its not like its 'challenging' hard either, its just 'pointlessly frustrating' hard.

So it ends up just defaulting back to normals eventually once the fun has long since drained away, and he's done all he can to climb and gotten nearly nowhere, and fair enough, because when you're playing to have fun, why would you choose to play at that level, instead of a level where you can function as a team and improve yourself?
No one improves when you're not playing against people of your own level. It's like going back to pre-school, it doesn't matter how good your grades are, you're still not getting any smarter.

#Your mistakes forever haunt you...

He made one mistake like 6 years ago in placements, and is still punished for it every season. Meanwhile his Gf who has been playing for just over a month gets placed higher than he's ever got. And we are all very proud and happy for her of course, don't get me wrong! and she's pretty good too. But those where his placements too, he put in just as much effort as she did. But he gets bronze 5 as per usual, just because of the weight of previous years constantly dragging him down, all because he didn't have a caring partner to help him through his first placements years and years ago.

What is the point of the system when someone whose skills are clearly more advanced, can't make any headway. When others have higher ranks just dished up and served to them, purely because they happened to have a few good games the first time they played.


____________

#Conclusion

So my point is, either placements should mean dick-all and you just get placed at or around your existing rank, so you can just continue the climb from where you left off and don't get your fingers stamped on at the top of the cliff every new season, **OR** they should mean pretty much _everything_, and the start of each new season gives you a second chance at being placed.

Obviously this post or any like it will change nothing, this system is more convenient for our holy _'lords-and-saviours'_ at Plat + level, and god-forbid anyone other than them should matter, but it still makes me really annoyed seeing him constantly get this end of the stick, so I just had to say something.

replies.body:
Last year's placements put me in bronze 3/4 after winning 8-2, I climbed to silver V over the season. Then gold V over end of season/preseason, hovered in very very low MMR (silver 3-4) for a very long time (but my rank was protected because my MMR has to be faaar lower to go back to silver)

This year I went 4-6 and got placed silver 4.

Norms MMR is not representative of ranked at all, I've gone vs plats and won because they're intentionally on off roles, off meta or first timing a champ. In my time in gold elo they were far more skilled.

I'd like to believe that if I started a new account my MMR would somehow be better and I'd play well, but that just isn't true. I've seen streams of pro players being placed in plat or gold after placements, which was where faker was placed when he got so good at norms the matchmaking couldn't find anyone better. And clearly not every pro player gets challenger MMR in norms before moving onto ranked

Finally, and most importantly, people are bad at evaluating the skills of themselves and those above them. Maybe your friend really is a bronze-low silver player. We don't have replays or anything, and it's easier to believe that than the system somehow being programmed into screwing you over.

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/73x4bj/highest_rank_you_can_get_placed_on_fresh_account/

this is an interesting post. it shows there are significant differences in rank for placements (fresh accounts) based on 1 or 2 games. sometimes there are also unexplained differences such as 'Account 1' in that post.

why should short-term (1 or 2 specific matches) have such a significant impact on your rank? especially considering how obsessed riot are with pushing the 'long term' percentages rhetoric in response to people complaining about low elo.

I hate to be that guy, but I don't believe that one mistake from 6 years ago will forever haunt you in placements. I've been in the depths of bronze 5 also, and I've honestly never had issues with placement games. I'm pretty sure it goes off your previous season's MMR - so basically if he's got poor MMR then yeah he's going to be placed in the depths of bronze.

If you can't climb back to your original position you aren't good enough to be there. He is not punished for his mistakes (to an extent), he is punished because he is not good at the game and can't climb out of bronze. Yes, it is special territory (I was bronze 5 0 lp at one point rip) but it's definitely climbable and is easier than other divisions, it just depends on _how_ you play. You say he plays in roughly gold mmr norms and does well which is good, it doesn't mean he's a good enough player though or that level. 

Bronze is a rank where it's just filled with players who have absolutely no clue of anything. It's where 11 year olds will be found, people who don't play that much/try that hard/very new etc... or mentally disabled people (no flame).

If you have any game sense you would realise that they will do everything wrong. No mechanics, no macro, will do things for the sake of it. Yes, the 4 players on your team will fall into that, but the 5 on the enemy team also will (assuming no smurfs). Which means, if you just play  to carry it's easier than the other divisions. Win your lane or jungle (even as support, just play zyra/brand or something) and keep running down botlane until you get their inhibitors. They will forget about you, they will fight your team, they will try to kill you and fail. Yeah, 4v5's might be hard but you won't get them every game. It's just a matter of carrying bad players and if you can't do that you will never climb. 

If you try to get better and eventually reach gold + level of skill and actually think about how to win games, specifically in bronze you will climb very, very easily.

I completely disagree, I had the same issue as mentioned above, I was placed B3 my first ranked season a  few years ago, and because of Riot's system, I was forced to get placed lower for a few years in succession

> [{quoted}](name=ToroidalBoss,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=Y0nFvcfc,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-01-27T01:13:34.648+0000)
>
> I completely disagree, I had the same issue as mentioned above, I was placed B3 my first ranked season a  few years ago, and because of Riot's system, I was forced to get placed lower for a few years in succession

I was placed Gold 5 (fresh account) because I'm good at the game.

If you're hitting bronze off your promos, you're bad at the game.
I mean, it's more of a roulette if your bad at the game, you can easily hit silver as a bad player.

I agree with JasonWazza on this point, 
We all have both good and bad games, it doesn't matter how good you are.

If you just happen to have a few bad games when youre in provisionals, you suffer all season _(and beyond)_ because of it.
Likewise, if you're a terrible player, but happen to get awesome teams, you'll get placed higher than perhaps you should. 

Perhaps your internet went haywire during your provisionals (it happened to me one game in my flex placements this season), and maybe that gave you a loss you didn't deserve. 

There are too many factors in play to warrant these 10 games affecting your rank so harshly.
Maybe if placements where over 30 games they might be more accurate. But it's too easy to have a run of bad _(or good)_ luck in a span of 10 games.

The issue is not only is it hard to get out of bronze 5, the people that need to be there have a hard time getting there.

I had a "friend" that easily deserved bronze when they played ranked, they int feeded 10 games in a row essentially, and won 5 due to her team, and thus got placed in silver 4 (this was in season 5).

And from there, it takes FOREVER to actually get dropped into bronze (it took her until Season 7 to actually get down towards the rank she deserves).

Personally i don't understand a few things.

1) Why it starts us at Silver 4 MMR standard, this isn't fun for new players, and this isn't fun for anyone who has to play with the new players, especially since you can go straight in at 30 and basically int feed because your not up to that skill level at all.

2) Why dropping down from Silver 5 is so hard, i get that all the tiers have a safety net, i don't understand why the thought is that it's needed for the silver Bracket, let these players witness their drop, and they might actually strive to get better.

3) The first set of placements for a player, contrary to every other set of provisionals etc. should actually take Score and grading into account, generally speaking this is a easier way to work out the placement of a player to start them off, if someone is constantly going 0/9 the game should actually push them down regardless of the win, i get there ARE edge cases for this, but for the original placements it would do better to have this in place.

Yeah, I don't know how I feel about placements. I pretty much always place bronze 3, climb to bronze 1/2 and then give up after a couple of promotion series (a defense mechanism, to ensure I don't start hunting my league team mates). If i started a new account and did placements I am sure I would place higher. But at the same time, the guy that taught me league climbed from Bronze 5 to 3 in a single night of us slamming rank before the season ended. So climbing is definitely possible. And Yellowbrickroad is proof that even if you place in silver, unless you deserve it you'll plunge. 

So I don't know man.
